title: ISignThis founder is used to scrutiny
text:
iSignthis' John Karantzis: "welcomes" regulatory scrutiny Supplied

The ASX and ASIC may have indefinitely suspended it from trading, but the ISignThis CEO and founder isn't worried.

“The company welcomes any opportunity to address regulator queries, which are a normal part of operating in regulated markets and industries, and is fully co-operating with regulators," John Karantzis said last week, rather implausibly, about the highly unusual forced and immediate suspension brought about by two agencies at once.

But then again, Karantzis has had plenty of success holding his own. The very formation of ISignThis was mired in legal contestation, which Karantzis came out of very well back in 2015.

At the time, Karantzis, through his company Southern Ocean, was a consultant to refinery Sugar Australia, when his services were abruptly terminated by a new CEO, who wanted to bring things in-house. Later, looking into it, Sugar Australia refused to give Karantzis any of his owed termination payments, alleging a coterie of sins, the most pertinent to our interests being that Karantzis' concurrent work on ISignThis meant he couldn't be fulfilling his contractual obligations to work full-time for Sugar Australia.

Neither this nor much of Sugar Australia's other allegations convinced Victorian County Court Judge Maree Kennedy, who threw most of Sugar Australia's case out and awarded Karantzis total damages of $265,000 (minus a phone bill of $164,160 he had to pay back).
